episodeTitle: Everything is for Her Friends! Robin in the Darkness!
episodeTitleJapanese: Subete wa nakama no tami ni! Yami no naka no Robin!
episodeTitleRomanized: Subete wa nakama no tami ni! Yami no naka no Robin!
description: A special filler episode featuring 'Monster Time' from the Straw Hat Theater series. In the monster town of Monston, Rodusa the gorgon has lost her favorite earrings. Her monster friends Lugyao, Chopaken, Stranami, Saneara, Ussopaka, and Zoromilk search for treasures to cheer her up.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Straw Hat Version)
openingSong.artist: Hiroshi Kitadani and the Straw Hats

events.title: Introduction to Monster Town (Monston)
events.description: The episode opens in Monston, a carefree monster town deep in a forest where various mythical creatures live together. The setting is introduced as a whimsical parody world featuring monster versions of the Straw Hat crew.
events.significance: Establishes the unique fantasy setting for this special Straw Hat Theater episode, creating a lighthearted alternate universe version of the crew.

events.title: Debut of Monster Crew Members
events.description: The monster versions of the Straw Hat crew are introduced: Lugyao (dragon), Zoromilk (minotaur), Stranami (mermaid), Ussopaka (centaur), Saneara (kappa), Chopaken (kraken), and Rodusa (gorgon).
events.significance: Introduces the parody character designs that reimagine the Straw Hats as various mythological creatures, each retaining their core personality traits.

events.title: Rodusa Loses Her Earrings
events.description: Rodusa the gorgon discovers that she has lost her favorite earrings, which makes her sad. As a gorgon, she wears sunglasses to prevent accidentally turning people to stone with her gaze.
events.significance: Sets up the central conflict of the episode and introduces Rodusa's character trait of being a gorgon who must protect others from her petrifying gaze.

events.title: Friends Search for Replacement Treasures
events.description: Seeing Rodusa's sadness, her monster friends Lugyao, Chopaken, Stranami, Saneara, Ussopaka, and Zoromilk decide to search for treasures to replace her lost earrings and cheer her up.
events.significance: Demonstrates the theme of friendship and caring for crewmates, mirroring the core values of the Straw Hat Pirates even in this parody setting.

events.title: Friends Present Treasures to Rodusa
events.description: The monster friends return with various treasures they've found and present them to Rodusa to cheer her up. Touched by their kindness and friendship, Rodusa becomes emotional.
events.significance: Highlights the bonds of friendship between the crew members and shows how they support each other, reinforcing the 'nakama' theme central to One Piece.

events.title: Accidental Petrification Ending
events.description: Overcome with emotion and happiness, Rodusa turns away to hide her tears. When she turns back to thank her friends, her sunglasses fall off, and she accidentally turns all of them to stone with her gorgon gaze.
events.significance: Provides a comedic and bittersweet ending to the story, showing both the depth of Rodusa's emotions and the unintended consequences of her gorgon nature.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the importance of friendship and supporting your crewmates when they're sad, even in a lighthearted parody setting.
themes.symbolism: The monster friends searching for treasures to replace Rodusa's earrings symbolizes how true friends go out of their way to help each other.
culturalReferences: Various mythological creatures from different cultures are featured, including Greek mythology (gorgon, centaur, minotaur), Japanese folklore (kappa), and universal fantasy creatures (dragon, mermaid, kraken).

themes.description: Despite Rodusa's best intentions and precautions, her emotional moment leads to an accidental petrification of her friends.
themes.symbolism: The fallen sunglasses represent how even safety measures can fail in moments of strong emotion.

characterSpotlights.development: Rodusa is portrayed as a caring friend who is touched by her friends' kindness, but also as someone who must constantly be careful due to her gorgon nature.
keyActions: Is touched by her friends' efforts to cheer her up
Accidentally petrifies her friends when her sunglasses fall off

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original content adapted from the Straw Hat Theater manga omake series. It is not part of the main One Piece manga storyline.
mangaDifferences.mangaReference: The 7th Log: Vivi (Straw Hat Theater - Monster Time)

trivia.fact: This is the last episode to use 'We Are! (Straw Hat Version)' as the opening theme.
This is the last episode to have a 1:30 runtime opening until a later episode.
Monster Time is the last Straw Hat Theater story to be animated in the One Piece anime.
In the Monster Time story, characters frequently use the word 'fantastic' to emphasize the fantasy setting.
Most of the creature types featured in Monster Time have since appeared in the main One Piece storyline.
Monster Time was originally published on May 2, 2006, in The 7th Log: Vivi before being adapted into Episode 283.
